title: Lynn man charged in kidnapping, murder of older sister
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Smith, 30, from Lynn, charged with kidnapping and murdering his sister, Michelle Knox, aged 38.
Smith pleaded not guilty in Lynn District Court; case impounded, restricting access to case records.
Smith's past includes a guilty plea for assault with a weapon, acquitted of serious charges in 2020.

title: Patriots captain believes defense showed ‘glimpse of dominance’ vs. Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots captain Harold Landry recorded 2.5 sacks in a 20-13 loss to the Raiders in Week 1.
Landry and Milton Williams led the Patriots with seven pressures each against the Raiders' QB Geno Smith.
Despite a strong pass rush, the Patriots' defense allowed 362 passing yards and nine explosive plays by Las Vegas.

title: David Andrews believes this was most disappointing part of Patriots’ season-opening loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Andrews expressed disappointment in the Patriots' run game during their 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
The Patriots, despite strong running back talent, focused on passing with Drake Maye attempting 46 passes.
New England managed just 60 rushing yards, failing to establish expected ground game against the Raiders.

title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm to lead first Bruins training camp on September 17 as head coach at Warrior Ice Arena.
Sturm focuses on intensity and accountability as Bruins prepare for a busy season with 33 wins last year.
Improving defense and power play crucial for Bruins, with Jeremy Swayman expected to improve from .892 save percentage.

title: Worcester girl testifies against man accused of kidnapping her, throwing her off bridge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Worcester girl testified against Joshua Hubert, accused of kidnapping, raping, and throwing her off a bridge in 2017.
Hubert faces multiple charges, including attempted murder, kidnapping, and aggravated rape; he pleaded not guilty to all charges.
The trial, delayed since 2020, started with opening statements; the victim described pretending to be dead during the attack.

title: Drake Maye doesn’t think he has ‘too much on his plate’ and more from WEEI interview
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye denies that the Patriots are overloading him despite struggles in season opener against the Raiders.
Maye acknowledges need to avoid turnovers after pivotal interception led to Raiders' comeback win.
Maye comments on Patriots banning their scout from UNC, supports Belichick's authority despite alumni ties.

title: ‘Game 1 is always the hardest’: Patriots veteran shares perspective on Will Campbell’s debut
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookie Will Campbell faced challenges in his Patriots debut, with penalties and pressure affecting his performance in the third quarter.
Veteran Morgan Moses praised the growth of rookies Campbell and Jared Wilson despite their struggles during the game against tough opposition.
Patriots' offensive line allowed four sacks in a 13-point performance, continuing their struggle from last season's low scoring average.

title: Kayshon Boutte reflects on his forgotten history as an elite prospect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kayshon Boutte was once compared to Stefon Diggs but slipped to a sixth-round pick due to injuries.
Boutte showed promise at LSU, becoming the fastest receiver to reach 100 catches in just 21 games.
Boutte's preseason performance earned him a key role as one of New England's top receivers alongside Diggs.

title: Hasbro is relocating its headquarters to Boston’s Seaport
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Hasbro is moving its headquarters from Pawtucket, Rhode Island, to Boston’s Seaport, taking seven floors at 400 Summer St.
About 700 full-time employees will transition to the new Boston headquarters by the end of 2026, according to Hasbro.
Hasbro's CEO cites Boston's business community and cultural vibrancy as key factors for the relocation.

title: Wu heads into preliminary election with massive 50-point lead over Kraft
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Emerson College poll shows Mayor Michelle Wu with a 50-point lead over Josh Kraft ahead of Boston's preliminary election.
Wu secures 72% of likely voter support, compared to 22% for Kraft, increasing her lead since a 30-point advantage in July.
The preliminary election will narrow the candidate field for the general election on November 4, with Wu and Kraft expected to advance.
